intro: Ardisia quinquegona var. hainanensis, commonly known as the Hainan ardisia, is a flowering plant native to southern China, particularly Hainan Island. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
